intro: Stemodia jorullensis, commonly known as the Jorullén stemodia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. It thrives in sunny, well-drained environments, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
